meaningMnemonic: Your <kanji>joint</kanji> <kanji>joint</kanji>s are your <vocabulary>various joints</vocabulary>, or even <vocabulary>every joint</vocabulary> in your body, or a specific body part. When we're not talking about the joints in your body, this means something like <vocabulary>various parts</vocabulary>, referring to various parts of a whole.
readingMnemonic: This is just the kun'yomi of 節, which you learned with 節目, repeated twice. Keep in mind that the second ふし gets rendaku'd to ぶし!
